reviews.review_msg: He is an excellent instructor. He teaches very well and the assignments are fare. His exams are  relatively hard and time consuming. If you don't study beyond the course and do the assignments yourself, you will get a good mark. Try to attend all the lectures and MANAGE your TIME in the exams. ;)

He is a very responsible teacher and always willing to help you. His lecture is good and clear.You can see him in the workshop everyweek. Before the final exam, he gave his students more office hours and spent his extra time reviwing problems with them.
Good notes, willing to help you but I find his exams hard.
I got a very bad mark on this test too. Yet indeed he's a really good teacher. Don't totally rely on the questions in the assigned problems and do MORE!
He teaches okay, but ... His exams is very, extremely difficult. BEWARE!
lectures are good; very considerate of the course material and student learning level
Pretty good for math, lectures well
No Comments
Not a very good teacher, but a nice guy
Terrible prof. Went to class for first week and never again. So hard to understand. The average mark was 36% or sumthing in the class.
EASY :)

I think Professor Gray was an excellent professor for the PRIME section in Fall 2024. He may initially seem intimidating, but he genuinely cares about students, is very willing to answer questions, and wants to see you succeed. Ask questions after class, attend lectures, take notes, and do all the practice textbook questions! You've got this!

Professor Gray runs a well-structured course. While his lectures can be dry, the textbook and practice problems are invaluable. Attending class and using resources like unstuckstudy for study prep are key to success.

I liked Justin very much. At first he seems a little intimidating. But if you seek for help, ask questions during office hours he is very helpful, patient, and calm. His lectures and notes are very organized and easy to follow. Fair grading.

Took 251 in the spring. Incredibly well organized notes and examples used in class. I found the first mt harder than the 2nd, but both were very fair. Final was incredibly fair, I found it easier than the assigned weekly questions and I did the entire final 3 times during the exam. Loved the course, it made me transfer from business to math no joke

Justin is a nice guy. He genuinely cares about his students and he teaches quite well. The only downside was that his lectures were pretty boring. The quizzes and exams were fair but the final was a lot harder than previous assessments. Regardless, he is a solid choice for this course.
Best math prof I have ever had! Explains really well and cares for students. The problem solving clinics were very helpful and motivating to work in a group.

He's definitely not a  bad guy but his lecture is kind of boring especially when you use jamie's video for pre lecture and he's always a lit bit behind his own schedule kind of boring for 830 classes. Anyway his test is fair and time is enough as long as you prepared with questions behind the textbook
Everything is based on the textbook. If you can deal with the textbook questions you will be fine in the exam

His lectures were okay, but made me fall asleep quite often. Quiz questions are taken from hw questions so if u finish all your hw, u should be good. The final exam was very straightforward and tbh a lot easier than his midterms. Overall, not too bad of an experience being in his class
Decent prof overall, nothing stands out. If you put in the work, your mark will reflect it. Better than Pyke, lol
NOT RECCOMONDED!
Class avg was C+. Not recommended!

This course is tough to begin with, but Justin is a good professor who explained the material very clearly. Lots of homework questions are assigned to make sure that you have a solid understanding of concepts. Justin was sometimes a bit disorganized and would post lecture slides less than an hour before the lecture, but he was still great!

He was really fair past midterm 1. I agree that we were given too many questions for midterm 1 and too little time to complete. However, in the latter part of the course he was really fair. He scaled the class in the end, so if you did significantly better on the finals than on one of the midterms, the finals would be worth a lot more.

He was a really fare prof and explain every concept despite of the limited time he had for his lecture. but i do think this course need more time. work outside of the class is mandatory as its a challenging course. His exams are fare too.
Math is hard to teach and hard to make super enjoyable. This man here is amazing. Exams are very fair and he goes the extra mile to make sure we understand stuff. Probably my favorite prof to date.

Does not give good exam review (not telling which question will be on and just spending time in true/false that never will be on the exam) and copy example from the textbook. Make a lot of mistakes in his lecture.
Doesn't give enough time for midterms, and reads off his lectures notes
cute guy!! explain things so clearly!!  tests are ok!!
Nice Looking guy...and of course.....he's pretty nice too...he explains things clear

Dr. Mishna teaches one of those courses that just never gets boring. Calc 3 had very difficult content but she was always lighthearted and got us through it. She is always willing to help on homework questions if you are struggling. She is an amazing professor and an amazing person. If I see she is teaching a course I can take I would take it.

Fantastic lectures, for once I preferred my math prof's explanations over those of the textbook. Lots of homework but she just wants to force you to understand the content of the class in-depth. Gave a make-up exam and curved my grade up on the final after it became apparent that people struggled with a certain chapter. Overall excellent professor
She takes the time to work through things with her students and is very willing to meet and discuss material and marks

I don't know many people who enjoy taking math courses, but Jamie was by far the best math professor I have ever witnessed. Amazing online lectures, plenty of tutorial time and his exams were more than fair. If you have the chance to take Jamie for any math course, I would HIGHLY recommend!
The only problem was that the assignments were extra and not useful. He uses WebAssign and it's enough work. Also, you really need a high mark to get A because the average is high.
THE GOAT.
great teaching style, and fair midterms if u have studied. but final is difficult.... overall, he is a great prof to take.
his teaching style is great, and makes you involved into the class. midterms are fair, but final is difficult (and some questions are impossible to solve).... overall, he is a great prof to take.
His midterms and final are fair.
He's great at explaining theory and concepts! As well, he's funny and very entertaining in lecture too. His exams tests a lot of theory, so know all your material!
his lecture and notes are clear! explain everything excellent !
everything was well explained. quite a nice prof!
great prof explained everything well, midterms and final were hard but very fair.
Best math prof at SFU his midterms and final were fair but he gives weekly quizzes out different from the homework questions so you have to know your material well

he explains material clearly, his midterms are fair, his final was kind of difficult tho. Make sure you know the last 2 chapters really really well, since final mostly coveres those chapters. Good proff overall . Wish he was teaching 254 or 310 as well.
A+ professor, one of the best math professors at SFU. His midterms and final were fair. Highly recommended professor, he cares and helps his students.

Such a nice prof always encouraged questions and never made you feel dumb, always inspired me and made course content much more enjoyable midterms did feel rushed but the exam was very fair but he did post online lectures pretty late sometimes
He is a VERY unorganized guy.

I found Dr. Singh to be accommodating to the shift to online learning. Throughout the semester he would listen to the class when it came to how we felt the course was being delivered. Overall a pretty solid prof!

Lectures are mostly clear and thorough; although he sometimes jumps between points, he makes up for it by being super approachable and helpful. During office hours he always makes sure the student understands his answer before moving on, never scolds students for asking "dumb" questions like some profs, and listens to feedback. Overall a great guy

He's such a good Math professor. Sometimes he makes very tiny mistakes in lecture notes, but that's fine because he is a super busy and hardworking professor. You will find your way enjoying his class anyways.

By no means is this class easy but taking it with Vijay really made it a pleasant experience. You can tell he wants everyone to succeed because he goes out of his way to provide help when you ask for it. This class does require you to spend time doing the assignments because that's what you're tested on and that's how you get the best grade.
Great prof.  Weekly quizzes got confusing near the end of semester. Midterms and final was fair. Bonus questions helped a lot. Do all the assigned questions and youll do fine.

Easy A, take it with him if you want a GPA booster. Teaches right out of the textbook, didn't show up at least 80% of the classes and aced all his midterms and final. Is a nice man and genuinely care about his students and how well they do. Average for midterm were both around 60 ish and the final average was 55.

Michel's tests are fair, but his lectures are just him reading off his slides. He posts the slides online, and I faired better by learning the content online. Overall his class did not require a lot of work, but just be prepared to learn on your own.
This man is just a lad. Nice guy, good lecturer.
best math proffessor i ever had. He knew everything. Even though i got a crummy grade (for me) i learned a hell of a lot.  I just goofed the final.

Generally a nice guy. Very helpful. Yeah he talks too fast during lectures. His lectures are well organized. Willing to give very close to answer hints to the students for on line assignments. Exams are not too easy (not too hard either).

uses webct discussion board.  tries hard but seems a little nervous speaking in front of class - speaks too quickly sometimes.  open to suggestions.  lecture notes are a mess.  doesn't quite "enlighten" class but overall a pretty good prof.
Sometimes its "pretty straight forward" for him, not for me.
He's a TA so he should be a good teacher. However, he talks WAY too fast...and he likes to say "ok, so let me just write this down".
Exams were hard. Assignments were hard. Assigned a book but some stuff she taught wasn't in the book. Wouldn't recommend anyone to take any class with her.
jf williams writes his own reviews.

It seems that downloading the notes he writes in class and learning off of them on your own is a better solution than going to lecture since it's basically the same content. The advantages of downloading the notes are not having to go through him correcting himself over and over, and being able to stay at home in a comfortable environment. MATH130.

Makes a large number of mistakes in lectures and wastes time correcting them. Great otherwise.  All the people complaining are crybabies that don't like how JF tries to instill intuition within his students.

A prof who challenges his students. He made me respect and want to learn the depths that come with Calculus. Exams can be difficult if you are one that masters the art of solving certain problems, but lack the mastery of solving the problem transformed. Weekly quizzes (10%) + Loncapa (5%) + 2 MTs (35%) + 1 Final (50%)  JF Williams Math 251
midterms always hard even ta said his test is tricker than others. So much stuff has been covered for each lecs too

Had a very difficult midterm. Most questions are sort of like trick questions in an unfamiliar format coupled with very a long paper. Expects too much from the students who are taking 200 level courses. Avoid when you can because on the fourth week he will suggest you to drop out if you find his course tough anyways (with tuition fees penalty).
He is a crystal clear lecturer and his midterms are pretty straight forward. Easy A.
He is keep making mistakes and getting lost in his lecture.

Math 251 is itself a hard course already and he made it even harder. midterms are fair. the final exam was brutal but definitely possible to do well if you really understand ALL of the assignments. lectures are lively but useless, abuse your textbook as much as you can. work hard and you should be amply rewarded

JF is a very nice and friendly person. His lectures are useless and waste of your time. His midterms way too long, no one finished it. His final exams is long and unfair. The average for final exams was 48%...i worked very hard for this course and i am a smart guy, But my actuall grade was barelly passing, he scales 20% at the end but he sucks at t
Homework seems relevant to exams...though still challenging Dunno what to say...He is the friendliest person you'll meet though.
Nice teacher BUT bad lectures you dont learn anything and messy notes AND HARD tests and quizes every week
WHAT A LIVING HELL

Easily one of the worst profs I've ever had. His lectures are alright but barely covers anything cause he's so slow! Even worse, he gives hard exams, lies about basically everything, doesn't respond to emails, all of which caused us to fall behind. In the long run you will have to teach yourself just to survive in his class. Avg for MT1 was 39%

please avoid. i didnt know what was on our final till 3 days before which was so awkward. he also gave lectures on material that would be on our quiz the day of. his old notes were the only way i learnt,,, notes that were almost ten years old. the material itself isnt horrible, but the disorganization ruined it.

Ralf is a sweet man, but he is not a good prof with online learning. He could not keep up with the lectures, leaving the class behind in many aspects. He does not reply to emails and is not organized. Although, if you attend his Q&A lectures he's very helpful. Might be better in person but I do not recommend taking an online class with him.
Very clear when explaining materials in the course.

Ralf is awesome! He gives long assignments with lots of questions but he doesn't check homework ( but the quizzes and tests are basically out of the homework so). His exams are fair but for the midterms they're really hard to write in the allotted time. He expects averages to be around 50% but he scales. TLDR: Take a course with him!!!

This man is fantastic, he's a wonderful teacher. My grades jumped from about 50% in MATH 151, 152 to about 75% in MATH 251. In retrospect, it wasn't even "easier" material either. Ralf is probably the best math prof I've had. The man is rich in intelligence.

The questions he asks on the quizzes and exams are right out of the textbook or the homework. But you are very limited for time when writing the exams, his first midterm he expects the average to be 50%. It is low because very few people can finish it in the allotted time. But he is very thorough in his instructing.

well he gives so much homework that you pretty much are not even left with time to finish anyother course's work. his midterms are easy but SUPER LONG and final is HARD and EXTREMELY LONG you can never finish it ever no matter what

I love Ralf!He is a great prof and he is graduated from Princeton U!His notes are so systematically and with a great help even you don't need the textbook.Midterms are okay but the fianl is REALLY hard!But this is a pretty easy course. I hope I can meet Ralf someday again! I really like this prof.
He explained materials so clealy that they become tedious. Always behind schedule. But notes and explanation are crystal clear.Exams are reasonable.A+ for me.
Explains most things in terms of physics which sucks for people who have never done any physics. At least he usually gives enough examples. I didn't enjoy this class at all.
Even though he is a very nice guy, but his accent is hard enough to understand, and he mumble, and talk so quick, which makes it impossible to understand what he is saying. Always fall behind......

His exams are too long. Always late for the class. Always behind the schedule. We actually had to read the text to do the assignments so i really don't know what  was the point of going to his lectures. Left us for 5 lectures to go to some stupid seminar in the US. Couple of times assignments were not available until 24 hrs to the due date.

Good prof, organized lecture notes (although they were from a different textbook he used before); neatest writing I have ever seen from a prof.  Posts his notes online so lectures are superfluous, especially since he was always behind schedule so we had to read the textbook ourselves to do the HM anyways.  Reviews really helped explain the material
He is extremly unorganized and mostly late for his own lectures! exams are too hard and he has a stupid way of marking them!
the nicest guy in the world

Justin Chan is the goat. I only feel bad that 70% of the class did not show up to lectures because of material readily available on the internet. He gives very thorough answers and explanations and is more than happy to help you with any questions you might have. Don't be intimated by him, he's a good communicator and cares for his students.

Amazing math prof for sfu surrey. Clear and easy to read lecture notes. Always asks if people have any questions. Quizzes are fair in difficulty. Responds quickly to emails. Polite and easily approachable. One of very few profs I would personally love to have again in the future.
DING DING!

Ping Ding uses the textbook as a crutch to teach this class. His lectures will lull you to sleep as he reads from the textbook-provided power point slides. If you stay on top of the material on your own, you can get above a B in this class. Do his review questions for the midterms and final; exams have strikingly questions.
Amazing professor, exams can be hard, but she's passionate and engaging as a lecturer.

I had weiran for calc 3 and 4 and honestly shes a really solid professor, clear grading outcomes, lectures well and provides alternative ways to explain concepts you can tell she knows her stuff. I would say quizzes are really difficult and she expects more than whats taught in class sometimes but shes good tbh
Pretty sure shes a spy yikes

shes ok at teaching, midterms are somewhat reasonable but the weekly quizzes are actually horrendous. The quizzes are always filled with some random really difficult question we havent seen. if you HAD to take this prof sure, if you can take another maybe go with the other prof
So bad!!!!! Horrible!!!
doesn't post notes. literally no reason not to, just gonna make students show up to class sick
Lots of self learning
Doesn't post lecture note and her lectures were very confusing

Calc 3 is a hard class and she doesnt make it any easier. Lectures spend wayyyy to much time going over the very basics and not enough time on the complicated problems you will see in exams. She is very kind and helpful when she had office hours but she wasnt available a lot. Overall a decent prof in a hard class.

Definitely did not study as much as i should've. Dont think the textbook is mandatory but you will need a lot of practice. She is nice but her explanations are a bit hard to understand or she goes through examples very fast. The tests were so much harder than the homework but that might be because its calc3. Study a lot of different questions!!
Pretty bad

She makes the course unnecessarily difficult. Quizzes are very difficult. I knew the answers to several quiz questions but couldn't write them down in time. Lectures: rushed Exams: UNPREDICTABLE questions. I'm a grad student, I did ALL questions in the textbook, STUDIED 7-11 HOURS A DAY (no kidding), got an A- in 152, and I'm aiming for a C

The term "icon" has at times become overused in modern society. However, I do not hesitate to use it to describe Weiran Sun. Her ability to connect with students is unparalleled, and she can make even the most boring material appear riveting. She breathes life into Mathematics in a way other profs simply do not.

She made this class a lot more difficult than it should've been. Her exams feature lots of questions with some of them to do with definitions and geometric meanings which made them impossible to finish on time, especially her final. Her explanations could be better and lectures were sometimes rushed.
Tests are very long , did not get to complete any of the 2 midterm. However she really let you understand the material that you are studying
Awful teachern. Not recommended for calc 251

Professor Sun lacks the ability to be an effective teaching member of the SFU mathematics department. She clearly demonstrates a very strong understanding on the mathematical theories and proofs but has issues relating the topics or presenting them appropriately. I found her lectures to be regurgitations of the textbook with no added explanation.

Midterms were long. Some parts of the final were relevant to the textbook, other parts were tricky. Wish the questions were more like homework assignments, which were rather helpful. Compared to other professors, her lectures could be more succinct.

nothing much to say......her lecture is pretty good and she is really nice. Midterm is long and a lil bit difficult but its aceeptable...The final...speechless...most difficult final ive ever had!.......

Calc 3 IS a tough course, but weiran makes it harder than needed. She is a very nice person, but as a prof, nope. Best just read the book. her mts are very long. Her final was not very long but a few of the questions were weird. No cheat sheets made this course an untamed beast. GL! :)
Dr. Sun is a great lecturer. Calc 3 is a difficult course and there isn't much she can do about that.
Midterms are really long and difficult

Calculus is hard.Do not expect it to be easy unless you are math genius.Her midterms are difficult but if you understand the materials well.You will be fine. Her english is pretty good and no heavy accent among other ESL profs. She makes another grading plan for us so the final worth 85%.
Midterms are difficult and long
VERY VERY LONG MIDTERMS
Very difficult to follow.

Lectures go VERY fast, so either read ahead or copy the notes from the text later. He can be a little condescending, but overall he tries to explain new material clearly. (If you ask about old material he will say, "That's just math 152, ok...") Exams were fair, but there are still tricky questions so study all examples and variations. Decent prof.
Very good professor. Material was somewhat difficult but he did a very good job at explaining it clearly and thoroughly during lecture. Probably one of the best math profs I've ever had.

Worst prof I've had. Teaches terribly, doesn't cover all the material, hard exams. Worst grade I've ever got, and the course itself is not that difficult. Should have skipped his lectures and studied on my own instead

Was really sensitive about the class volume and chatter but content in class was often good enough to not need to read the textbook or review to do assignments and quizzes. Same exact format as calc 1 and calc 2. sometimes Paul's notes can be a bit messy but he answers questions honestly.

Paul is great at simplifying complex topics, but he often ran out of time and didn't cover all content in lectures. However, he would fill in the notes completely and post them on Canvas afterwards. Homework assignments were excessively long given they were used as question banks for quizzes. Exam difficulty varied greatly, but the final was fair.
Really nice guy, good at explaining concepts. First midterm was fair, second midterm was hard, final was alright. Just lots of practice and you'll be fine!

Prof. Tupper makes a difficult math class very straightforward. He gives lectures that are easy enough to follow with skeleton notes. You must spend a good amount of time doing practice problems from the textbook. My only complaint was having no formula sheet on the exams, but many math classes do this for some reason.
custom message 1
paul tupper made the midterm difficult and he instantly regret it the next day!

I get the sense that Paul would be a great prof for upper-division courses. In this course, however, I found it hard to grasp the intuition behind many concepts (and I loved calc 1 and 2). Also, there's a lot of homework that's worth very little. A very large percentage of the grade was based on exams. Lots of memorizing of formulae.

He was an okay prof - some concepts explained well, others not so much. He sometimes skipped examples, which wasn't helpful. Tons of homework - weekly we assign and long written assignments that easily took hours each week. Quizzes and midterms were fair. Final was tough.
He was approachable outside of class.

Very fair quizzes, as they are directly based on assignment questions. Exams are also quite fair, though they can be a bit long. He's quite helpful during office hours, recommend coming to them if stuck. Lectures are pretty good for the most part, with different examples given.

Paul isn't the worst prof, as I had "worser profs." However, he isn't all that good either. His lectures are boring, he yaps a lot, and his notes are very messy and doesn't cover every math concept we need to do. In addition, his midterms are challenging and assigns a lot of homework. He is a nice guy at least. Personally, I wouldn't recommend him.

He's a pretty good prof overall. Sometimes his explanations of concepts are a bit iffy, but overall a great person. Exams are fair, and quizzes are taken right out of the homework assignments. Would recommend this prof.

This professor gives the worst in class examples as well he rarely actually explains the concepts and says to do it at home instead of him teaching us how to do it. Very good understanding of the concepts in the course, but a very poor professor who I would never recommend to another student hoping to learn something from his lectures.
This guy assigns 50 questions a week for homework ( questions are not handed in but tested on) midterm average was something like 11/25. avoid him.

Listen. I am not even taking his Math 251 course, im with another professor. However this man IS teaching my the content through his youtube videos better than my in person lectures. I can only imagine how great he when you actually take his class. 10/10 I would take a class with him in the future.

The best math teacher I have ever had. Amazing lectures, super fair exams, nice guy. Made Calculus 3, a very difficult course feel so easy the way he taught it. Definitely would recommend taking Dr. Mulholland if you get the chance.

The best prof I've ever seen. You just need to follow his lecture then can get A+ in his course. The course is curve and very easy to get A+. In the other math course, I studied harder and got total of 95, I still can not get A+.

Jamie was by far the best math prof I've taken. His lectures are super high quality and well made, with lots of examples and practice problems. The weekly WebAssign and assignment problems were somewhat difficult but well worth it. Having barely passed Calc I and II, this class felt much easier, and Jamie is the number one reason for it.
One of the best profs I had. Explains everything very clearly.

He gives good lectures and what's better is that the tests and quizzes are just like what he talks in the lecture. If you do the homework he gives, you should be fine with the midterms/final exam. Other than that, he's super caring. He always answers your email in a way you feel noticed.
One of the best teachers I have ever had the pleasure to learn from.

Jamie is a great teacher. He explains everything super intuitively and in-depth, and takes the time to answer any question, making sure everyone fully understands everything. His manner is approachable and he makes math seem easy and logical, rather than just being formula memorization. Only downside is the 8:30 AM start time.
Tried the best to give as much points as he can. Didnt expect to have a B but there it is.

Hands down the best math lectures I've seen. Uses technology (even hard codes his own geogebra examples) to help students understand the visual element of topics. Explains topics well. Cares about students, reasonable and passionate about math. I had fun in his class, and math wasn't my favorite subject.
Best
The worst prof i have ever taken
One of the worse math profs I've ever had
homework and practice exams won't help with tests. this close  to offing myself
Absolutely horrible, finals worth 50% and the exam is nothing like the sample questions. Makes you buy online resources for the online assignment. Just avoid taking classes with him.
Lectures are extremely boring and tests are nothing like homework or practice tests provided.
This professor is too hard

Listening to Lucas' lectures feels like watching paint dry would be a better use of my time. I have never skipped class but I have been tempted to bc he is SO painfully boring. He focuses on graphs instead of solving/helping you understand the lecture note examples. His exams are NOT like the hw or examples.

Decent at explanations, but unfortunately she spends far too little time explaining and instead focuses on repeated examples.  This is very bad if you aren't good at catching on to concepts quicily.  I HIGHLY suggest anyone who has her reads the textbook section for an upcoming lecture before attending.  Do this, and you'll be fine.
SUPER HARD COURSE.. DO NOT TAKE IT IF U DONT HAVE TO.. TEACHES TOO FAST GFG

notes are okay, midterms fair and she prepares you well if you listen-ie she tells you what equations to memorize-, but not good at explanations and    brushes of questions. explosive temper if there is any noise. evil final
Useful notes and fair exams
Good prof, hard final exams, seems like she needs a hug.  Maybe a couple hugs, and some stress relief.

The lectures can be hit or miss, but the textbook is solid. Exams are challenging, with not enough time to complete them. Using unstuck study and past practice materials really helped me stay on top of the content. Overall, a tough but manageable class if you put in the work.

I had him back in 2008 for calc3. I would say his knowledge of math is abundant and transparent during lectures but doesn't really teach u how to do problems. Lucky the textbook was good and there's google. His exams were lengthy with artsy wording but he does scale a lot. I stopped going to lecture after one month and just rely on textbook

David does not post his completed lecture notes so if you don't go to class you're going to need to ask someone for the notes. The lectures themselves are good. His exams are pretty tough, there are a lot of questions and not enough time to do them. He is around for help in person during office hours however he will be brutally honest with you.

Overall, I enjoyed his lectures. Notes were hard to read but he explained things pretty clearly (as compared to my calc 1 and 2 profs, who both had heavy accents). Both midterms were long and difficult, but the final seemed fair. He's a nice person and seems to care about his students but can respond to emails in a rude fashion.

Muraki is a kind enough professor but was never able to actually teach me anything in lectures because of his convoluted and hard to read notes, and because he presented the material in a way that doesn't help us on homework or exams. The textbook is the only thing that got me through calculus 3. Unfortunately, he also rarely responds to emails.

I emailed him 6 times throughout the term and only got 1 reply. Even when I asked about setting up a meeting I never got a response. He didn't even show up for online office hours. Lectures consist of few examples and largely him just rambling. The midterms were way too long and no time to finish, but the final was fair. He does not care about you

Lectures are always very clear with lots of examples and I like the way the prof teaches, but the exams are way too long to finish in the time given so you kinda just have to shoot for those part marks. Also, exam averages and standard deviations are not given so its hard to know where you stand. All together good though!

this guy doesn't post lecture notes or solutions to his sample problems and the homework is mandatory and you dont learn much from it. This class should be taught in a different way. like at very least upload solutions to your sample midterms like holy crap man

Decent lecturer, I did end up learning pretty well from him. He seems pretty passionate about what he does. However, he is very rude, does not appreciate being questioned at all, didnt encourage questions as he made you feel terrible if you said something wrong. Hes ok, but if you can avoid, dont take it with him

First midterm was hard, but if you studied and did HW you would be able to get a good mark. Second was ok. Final was difficult. He isnt rude, willing to sit you down and go through a problem if you have the notes/understanding of the question. He just is quite honest and will roast you. I recommend doing bonus questions(were on all quizzes/tests)
Exams are extremely hard and he uses ambiguous words. Assignments are tedious and he doesnt scale a lot. The average for the class is C. Lowest avg ever! for my other math classes they are all B-.
Exams are extremely difficult. Notes are hard to read. No filled note after class.
Awful, and very rude. Tried to make lectures relatable and funny but its not. His lectures are un-informative and exams are unreasonably hard.

He lectures ok and appears to care about students. However during office hours he is disrespectful and will criticize your abilities instead of helping you with your question. He will not correct you when you make mistakes. The exams are tough and ambiguous and he will scale a lot. Avoid if you can.

Awful lectures. Extremely hard exams. Averages on the midterms were like 30% on the first and then 50% for the second. Would not recommend.  I know quite a few people who dropped this class specifically becuase of this prof. I wish I could have done the same. There are better within the department. Calc 3 is hard enough already. you dont need this.

It's very difficult to hear what professor says in lectures and the lecture notes are not really helpful, better focus on textbook. Professor require you fully clearly understand each topics. Midterms are extremely long and not possible to finish, average is very low. But final is okay and final grade is acceptable.

It's really difficult to hear his voice in class and the lecture notes are not really useful.Better to focus on textbook samples. This professor needs you fully and clearly understand each chapter and midterms are hard and long, final is ok and overall grade is acceptable
The 1st midterm was very hard but the second one and final exam were easy. If you go over his assignment, you would get at least B.
Great prof!

Dont print out his notes,waste of money,time,paper,ink.y?he takes the things out of the book.exams are and fair,best prt is he scales alot! around 60sumthing% is an A- or B. intructor questions are very helpful for tests.Loncapa is doable=). In lectures he enjoys talking in depth about how mathematics apply to the world we live in!
Helpful instructor questions to benefit students. The exams were all fair. But try to understand the concept not just memorize the formulas since he will word the questions differently in the exams.
Really nice guy, but questionable teaching ability. Hard class, sure, but he wasn't able to make the material any more digestible. I had to self-study a lot using online videos and textbooks.

the fact that it is his first time teaching, he lacks confidence. he needs time to fix this. this professor's exam and term are way far to match the style of the text book. sorry, but this is the fact.

I'll probably rate him 3.5. Fiachra is really nice guy. Always being helpful and patient. Questions are encouraged during lecture. But the thing is, he can't always explain the content very clearly while 251 is really tough. He also seems to lack confidence sometimes

Quality lectures with following online assignments to prepare well for the exams. Also the first professor I've approached during office hours and he's respectful and actually helped my understanding. Highly recommend.
Jake is nice and caring

Dr. Goddyn is an excellent professor. Hilarious class and you can tell he is enthusiastic. 5/5. My only complaint is that his class is so easy. The content in 251 is not abstract and in 3D. Math 251 is supposed to be more challenging, instead of memorizing all formulas, writing all formulas in exam paper and you will get an easy A+.
very good prof, you can fell his passion and love for math. there are same mistakes on notes. thats ok. I will take him other courses. super good and kind prof in SFU

Dr. Goddyn is probably the most energetic math prof you will ever have at SFU. He runs into lecture every morning at 8:30 and greets everyone with a cheery, "Happy Monday!" He tends to make errors in his notes though. His exams are generally fair but too often there wasn't enough time to complete his quizzes.

Notes are messy and sometimes misses the important details. He speaks as if you know all the math lingo. The exams weren't particularly hard, but they were quirky... Homework was okay, and there wasn't too much of it. Overall not worth waking up in the morning to go to class to. I self-studied a lot and did pretty well.

Homework is based on textbook questions, however exams are based on what he thinks is a good indicator of knowledge. Don't take this course with this professor as you will not enjoy the course, lectures are pointless to go to, as you don't learn anything. This teacher is a great example of why SFU is underfunded, and will always be 2nd to UBC.
The course material is fairly difficult for most people and made even more difficult by killer exams. So far, 50% in the course is equivalent to a B, so everything is curved fairly.
Let's just say this semester (2009 FALL) the average for his class was under 40%, that should clear up anything you want to ask :)
killer midterms and finals. material covered in class, and on homework assignments are no where near as difficult as the finals and midterms. STAY CLEAR OF THIS PROFESSOR. HE IS HORRIBLE

Well,to say honestly, he sometimes just speak in an undertone. Keep up to the screen or you'll be hard to catch up his messy notes...Accents okay, online assignments on LON-CAPA is not harsh as well as paper assignments...we'll see if his midterms are hard or not.

I quite enjoyed Dr. Trummer's lively, entertaining lectures, although they must be viewed as a supplement to the textbook rather than a replacement. His humour and love of calculus make his lectures can't-miss, but you must keep up in the book and do all the exercises in order to have a chance at killer exams. God bless whoever invented the curve.

Although he just doesn't teach from the text book, and has his own way of presenting the material, his lectures don't in any way prepare you well for his exams. The final exam's average was possibly the lowest in history (24%). But it was curved fairly.

lectures were awfully long, and clarity was often an issue. Lectures were not mandatory, however beneficial to attend. Final exam was very difficult, covered material outside course content. However, curved nicely at the end. Wound up with an A- and close to an A
materials are poorly explained. a huge difference between exams and assignments.

(Review for MATH 240 - there's no option for 240 at the moment)
Razvan Fetecau has been great so far for Math 240. Gives clear lectures and explain concepts nicely. Midterm was fair and similar to what was done in class. Quizzes are directly from homework questions, so make sure to complete them early.

No doubt calculus is hard. Coming from a math background, i can telll his finals were NOT from a mathematics respecting person. He is a perfect example of how education in big universities is all money making process or its just all about cramming. DO NOT take math 251 with him.
Hard midterms and final.He himself thinks they're easy though -_-. For some reason I don't think he had his mic on the whole semester
I would avoid him at all costs.

As the comments say below, his assignments are numerical, and exams are completely conceptual. You have no way of even preparing for exams, they're absolutely terrible. Avoid Razvan at all costs until he gains more experience teaching, and has a wake-up call regarding how difficult his tests are.

I would not recommend taking a class from him. He is helpful and a good guy but his exams are ridiculous compared to the material he covers in class. Exams are full of proofs and conceptual questions when these topics are not really covered in the course. Even if you do all the problems he assigned the exams are brutal.

THE MOST terrible professor i have seen in sfu, alway makes the quiz and exam too difficult. especilly the final, is totally different than the sample. holy sh*t. if you want to take math, he will kill your GPA

First off, this guy is a genius. He is hard & unsympathetic but is very clear and concise, perfect notes, hard mid-terms(50%avg on the first, 40% on the second) & final. He is very approachable/helpful in his office hours. You really have to be on your game to get a good mark with this prof. He's basically like "Get on my level, son, or perish".
BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORING!! he rushes through the material by doing examples from the text.. no imagination.

GO. TO. OFFICE HOURS!!! His lectures are indeed useless, however the lecture notes themselves are very detailed and easy to read for a quick review. I do wish he included more examples in notes so we could be exposed to some complex questions. In office hours he was quite good at explaining questions, although his writing is messy. Very hard tests!

I really wasn't a big fan of his 6 tests instead of midterms and a final format because each test felt like a midterm anyway so it just felt like a lot more work. Each test was also only out of 16 so if fail a question you lose a lot of points. Lectures were useless, basically a 50 min lecture squeezed into 15 min, but discussion hours were helpful
A test out of 16 marks worth like 18% of the final grade is messed up

Her notes are atrocious. F looks like T, r looks like v, 2 looks like z, and so on. Exams does not test on everything covered for no reason. eg. first MT left out 3D shapes, second MT left out Lagrange multipliers. 80% of lecture is theory and very redundant proofs. little examples and practice. Prepare to study the textbook urself and ull be fine.

She's a great prof, it's just that her accent is pretty harsh. Her exams are well related to the example exams she provides you. Her lecture notes are the main focus, not the textbook. Don't take the class with her if you are the type to skip class.
AVOID AVOID AVOID Inappropriately difficult coursework. Don't take her class unless you are an actual math genious. She is funny and entertaining though.
soooo hard,the hardest course in the whole universe . dont take it, u will regret i guarantee.
Her exam is so hard, incredibly hard!
I done like her, she's too energetic and always talk too much

I did not enjoy Chiaka's class. I found her to be condescending at times and she likes picking people out of the class to answer questions at random. She is a little too enthusiastic for me, but clearly not for others. I found her class really difficult to understand and I didn't like her teaching style.

She is a really good prof, loves Math and she shows you how to do everything. Also she makes sure that she engages the class so you wont dare to fall asleep! Midterms are always require some studies out from you, so if you dont go to class or dont do her assignments then you will not do as good by just merely attending lecture.
She's the best math prof I've had. She uses club references to teach us 3D calculus. Really enthusiastic and great at 8:30 in the morning. BEST PROF EVER.
She teaches really well. Can make difficult concepts easy to understand. However, sometimes it's difficult trying to hear what she is saying because she does have an accent. Overall, pretty good

Don't know where SFU found Chiaka, but SFU is damn lucky to have found a person of that calibre. Explains everything super well, and is super enthusiastic about math. Self proclaimed to talk about math all day. She may get a little judgemental if you ask her a trivial question, but she will still answer it.
Extremely enthusiastic, encourages lots of questions. Available for help after lectures, and responds promptly to emails. Best calculus prof I've had!

Randall is an amazing prof if you are willing to put the work in. His class is difficult, but you learn a lot from him. He is really helpful and willing to help outside of class. However, his notes and teaching style might not be for everyone.
Highly unorganized, take  his class if you have insomnia.
Taking his courses= INSANE EXAM, Low GPA, Tons of HOMEWORK and BORING CLASS. GOOD LUCK!
you should appreciate have Dr. J as professor.

He is an amazing prof who really cares about his students. I highly recommend going to his lectures as they were very insightful and he is very willing to answer questions during and after lectures. So long as you are not interrupting. His exams are tough but you will see similar question to the ones he does in class or you do for homework.

Dr. Jungic is by far the most passionate professors I've met to date. I don't ever rate profs or even go on this website but his passion and care for students swayed me to write this. He encourages questions and doesn't make you ever feel bad for asking them , he also makes you feel engaged and helps you understand in and out of lecture.

Honestly, I did not find the lectures helpful, but as someone who wants to study math, they were enjoyable. His passion for math is clear-- I respect him. Exams are very fair--do the assigned homework and they're easy. Provides a checklist for each exam and practice exam/qs. Keep up with the textbook readings (DO read) and course will be pleasant.
